dublin_core.dcvalue: Internet and mobile phones open new avenues for the optimization of health services in medical rehabilitation Various models of Internet delivered aftercare after psychosomatic inpatient treatment have shown promising results The focus of this report is on the experience in translating one of the promising models the Internet Bridge Internet Br cke to every day health care Effectiveness was estimated through comparison of 254 patients who were treated in a hospital specialized in psychosomatic medicine and who participated in the Internet Bridge as well as in the 1 year follow up in the frame of standard quality assurance between 2003 2010 with 364 patients of the same hospital who also participated in the 1 year follow up but did not utilize the aftercare Sustainable reliable and clinically significant improvements were more frequent in participants of the Internet Bridge especially with regard to psychological well being social problems and psychosocial competence at small additional costs Results are understood as encouragement to start translation to routine care accompanied by research
